title: 820-3332-A SSD problem
message:
Hi!

I have this A1398 with 820-3332-A board and Sandisk SSD.
Customer said that the macbook smelled funny and SSD was not recognised.
Under scope i found that:



Is it possible to do a data recovery/repair that SSD?

Thanks!

title: 820-3332-A SSD problem
message: Probably! If you can find the component, just don't overheat the BGA chips near it. Lucky it's something like that and not the main memory chips...

title: 820-3332-A SSD problem
message:
I'm searching John, but i really can't find that component online...you have some ideas?
Yes, i'm sure i can remove it/resolder it without using hot air and putting heatspreaders in memory ic's...just to be sure!

title: 820-3332-A SSD problem
message: I'd say get a used SSD to transfer the part from. I would make it data recovery pricing rather than fixing the SSD for long term use
